dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/410625509 at Tue Jan 21 18:48:19 UTC 2020

panels.title: 🗞️ Headline Metrics - 𝘦𝘹𝘱𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘬𝘦𝘺 𝘴𝘦𝘳𝘷𝘪𝘤𝘦 𝘮𝘦𝘵𝘳𝘪𝘤𝘴 𝘳𝘰𝘸 𝘧𝘰𝘳 𝘥𝘦𝘵𝘢𝘪𝘭𝘴

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions within a minute period. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Error Ratios

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"},
    0
  )
)

avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=""} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=""},
    0
  )
)

panels.title: RPS - Service Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Percentage time the latency SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Latency SLA

targets.expr:
sort(
  max(
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s1", alertstate="firing"} * 4
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s2", alertstate="firing"} * 3
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=~"|main", severity="s3", alertstate="firing"} * 2
  or
  ALERTS{environment="$environment", type="patroni", alertstate="firing"}
  ) by (alertname, severity)
)

panels.description: Percentage time the error ratio SLI for this service is within SLO
panels.title: 7d Error Rate SLA

panels.description: Total number of SQL queries pooled - stats_total_query_count
panels.title: Queries Pooled per Node - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Total number of seconds spent by pgbouncer when actively connected to PostgreSQL, executing queries - stats.total_query_time
panels.title: Total Time in Queries per Node - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Total number of SQL transactions pooled - stats.total_xact_count
panels.title: SQL Transactions Pooled per Node - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Total number of seconds spent by pgbouncer when connected to PostgreSQL in a transaction, either idle in transaction or executing queries - stats.total_xact_time
panels.title: Time in Transaction per Server - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Number of active connections per node
panels.title: Server Connection Pool Active Connections per Node - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(max(
  max_over_time(pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}[$__interval]) /
  (
    (
      pgbouncer_pools_server_idle_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
      pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
      pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
      pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"} +
      pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{type="patroni", environment="$environment", user="gitlab", database!="pgbouncer"}
    )
    > 0
  )
) by (database)
,1),0)

panels.title: Server Connection Pool Saturation per Pool - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078
Waiting Client Connections per Pool - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078
Active Backend Server Connections per Database - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078
Active Backend Server Connections per User - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: pgbouncer is single-threaded. This graph shows maximum utilization across all cores on each host. Lower is better.
panels.title: Max Single Core Saturation per Node - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078
Maximum Connection Waiting Time per Pool - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Total volume in bytes of network traffic sent by pgbouncer, shown as bytes - stats.total_sent
panels.title: Sent Bytes - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: Total volume in bytes of network traffic received by pgbouncer, shown as bytes - stats.total_received
panels.title: Received Bytes - THESE GRAPHS ARE INCORRECT. SEE https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/gl-infra/production/issues/1078

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.

targets.expr:
avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"},
    0
  )
)

avg(
  clamp_min(
    gitlab_service_ops:rate:prediction{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=""} -
    2 * gitlab_service_ops:rate:stddev_over_time_1w{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage=""},
    0
  )
)

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: Apdex is a measure of requests that complete within a tolerable period of time for the service. Higher is better.
panels.title: Component Latency: Apdex

panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better
panels.title: Component Error Rates - modified scale: (1 + n) log10

panels.title: Component Availability

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: Component RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better
panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

targets.expr:
sum by () (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)
+
sum by () (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_rollback{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_commit{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)
+
sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pg_stat_database_xact_rollback{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

sum by () (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)
+
sum by () (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_queries_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_sql_transactions_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)
+
sum by (fqdn) (
  rate(pgbouncer_stats_queries_pooled_total{type="patroni", tier="db", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])
)

panels.span:
Active db connection saturation per node.

Postgres is configured to use a maximum number of connections. When this resource is saturated,
connections may queue.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: active_db_connections component saturation: Active DB Connection Saturation

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

This resource measures all CPU across a fleet. If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs horizontal or
vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Postgres connection pool saturation per database node.

Sidekiq maintains it's own pgbouncer connection pool. When this resource is saturated, database operations may
queue, leading to additional latency in background processing.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"}
)
/
on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", name="gitlabhq_production_sidekiq"}
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_async_pool component saturation: Postgres Async (Sidekiq) Connection Pool Saturation per Node

panels.span:
PGBouncer single core saturation per node.

PGBouncer is a single threaded application. Under high volumes this resource may become saturated,
and additional pgbouncer nodes may need to be provisioned.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    sum(
  rate(
    namedprocess_namegroup_cpu_seconds_total{groupname=~"pgbouncer.*", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[1m]
  )
) by (groupname, fqdn, type, tier, stage, environment)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_single_core component saturation: PGBouncer Single Core per Node

panels.span:
Postgres sync connection pool saturation per database node.

Web/api/git applications use a separate connection pool to sidekiq.

When this resource is saturated, web/api database operations may queue, leading to unicorn/puma saturation and 503 errors in the web.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    (
  pgbouncer_pools_server_active_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_testing_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_used_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production"} +
  pgbouncer_pools_server_login_connections{user="gitlab", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", database="gitlabhq_production"}
)
/
on(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) group_left()
sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance) (
  pgbouncer_databases_pool_size{environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main", name="gitlabhq_production"}
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: pgbouncer_sync_pool component saturation: Postgres Sync (Web/API) Connection Pool Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    avg(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", environment="$environment", type="patroni", stage="main"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that are breaching their soft SLO thresholds at this instant

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 1 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Currently Saturated Resources

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their current value and weekly variance, have a high probability of breaching their soft thresholds limits within the next few hours

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 7 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Currently at Risk of being Saturated

panels.description: Lists saturated resources that, given their growth rate over the the past week, and their weekly variance, are likely to breach their soft thresholds limits in the next 14d

styles.linkTooltip: Click the link to review the past 30 day(s) history for this saturation point.
Click the link to find issues on GitLab.com related to this saturation point.

panels.title: Resources Forecasted to be at Risk of Saturation in 14d

panels.description: Resource saturation levels for saturation components for this service. Lower is better.
panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation

panels.description: Percentage of time that resource is within capacity SLOs. Higher is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      gitlab_component_saturation:ratio:avg_over_time_1w{
        type="patroni",
        environment="$environment",
        stage=~"main|"
      }
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: Long-term Resource Saturation - Rolling 1w average trend

dashboard.title: patroni: Overview
